content.description:
Wild laybacking and kneebarring marks the start of this bouldery route - kinda desperate but oh so satisfying. Pull up to a good stance, shake out, then fire the crux, which is thin and very hard to read. Everything sucks and faces the wrong direction ;) Finish with fun moves on bullet stone.

This is a super worthy route that deserves more traffic. The double kneebar no-hander is reason enough! Get pitted!!!
content.location: It is in the zone of sport routes on the far right side of the crag behind a large boulder. This is the second route from the right. The leaning, acute corner is obvious at the first bolt.

content.description:
A mellow start leads to balancy, sequential moves on a sharp arete feature. Mantel onto a stance, shake out, and then hit the second crux on thin crimps and smeary feet.

The route is a little contrived, because you can move left for easier climbing at a couple points, especially at the upper crux, but if you stay on the arete the whole time, it's a really fun, balancy line.

BTW, one of the many routes where the guidebook photo is wrong. The anchor is up and right - stay on the arete as long as possible looking for a bolted anchor on the right side - shared with Rubber Soul, a gear 5.8.
content.protection: 6 bolts? maybe some finger-size gear up high to protect 7/8ish terrain.
content.location: It is the farthest left route at the crag. A 3rd Class slab leads to bolts on the arete. There is a bolt line to the right that joins the arete at the 4th or so bolt, which goes at 11d.

climbs.name: Family Outing
climbs.fa: EL Foster, S Bevoy, M Bevoy

content.description:
An excellent pitch up a steep wall with great holds.  Follow a trail right of

Car Killer Crack

and find a nice, well-fractured area.  Climb cracks / dihedrals to a bolted anchor.
content.location:
About 100' right of

Car Killer Crack

.

content.description: There is surprisingly cool climbing on this obscure gem of route. This rig probably rarely gets done, but it deserves way more traffic! Steep, mostly juggy climbing with a couple cryptic moves here and there lead to a wild "Chopper" flake that is amazingly solid. Creative movement past this feature lead to a couple more balancy moves then some nice jugs and an anchor.
content.location: From the main area, walk right about 300 feet until you see a little zone with bolts behind a big boulder. The Chopper is the third routes from the right below the obvious tomahawk-like block that sticks out. Clip the first bolt from a ledge, 8' up.

climbs.name: Car Killer Crack
climbs.fa: E L Foster, C Peck, S Beuoy

content.description: Climb the crack / dihedral system facing the road - this is the first route you see as you walk up the road.
content.location: This the obvious crack system visible from the road.  A large tree at the top of the crack is easily seen.  This tree has rap slings.
